results.title: Bacteria and Health (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Diagrams and experiments show that by taking simple precautions such as disinfecting and dressing wounds, washing hands in soapy water and being aware of the presence of bacteria, we can remain healthy. It also discussed the ways in which our bodies cope with bacteria, and whether they are useful or harmful to the body.

results.title: Astronomy (Captioned)
results.brief_description: The night sky has always seemed mystical to man - over the ages he has imbued it with almost magical powers. Now, with the advent of bigger, better computerised telescopes, colour enhanced pictures, and radio telescopes than can completely encircle our planet, we are learning more about the night sky and so, ultimately, learning more about ourselves.

results.title: Marilyn Monroe: beyond the legend (Captioned)
results.brief_description: MARILYN MONROE: BEYOND THE LEGEND is a documentary tribute to the legendary actress. Numerous film clips show her earliest appearances in DANGEROUS YEARS and ALL ABOUT EVE, and her triumphant performances in BUS STOP and THE MISFITS. The film also features a wealth of rare archival and newsreel footage, as well as in depth interviews with colleagues and friends of the inimitable actress such as Robert Mitchum, Celeste Holm, Shelley Winters, Susan Strasberg, Don Murray, Sheree North, John Springer, and director, Josh Logan. Narrated by Richard Widmark.

results.title: Arthur Boyd: figures in a landscape (Captioned)
results.brief_description: A fascinating program that looks at the painting of Australian artist, Arthur Boyd. For the purposes of this peacefully but not passively photographed documentary, Arthur Boyd completed two different paintings of the same scene, an interior and exterior interpretation of bathers and water-skiers who regularly churn up the tranquillity outside his door, explaining as he works, his inspiration and intention.

results.title: Return to the dreaming (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Cecil Holmes, Robert Raymond and Opus Films
results.brief_description: Yirrawala, a great Aboriginal painter, takes his sons, who have grown up in the white man’s world, back into Arnhem Land in an attempt to find sacred caves and aboriginal art. During the journey, Yirrawala makes a bark painting in the traditional way and he shows us cave paintings never before recorded.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cecil Holmes, Robert Raymond and Opus Films

results.title: Study tips (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Wayne’s exams are two week away and he is in a panic. With Uncle Jack’s help he develops a positive attitude towards study and more effective study techniques. With Lance Curtis and Geoff Kelso. This entertaining program provides simple tips on improving study skills, for lower and middle secondary school.

results.title: Robin Hood Junior (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Lord Gilbert is away at the Crusades and the evil Baron has taken over Locksay Castle. Lord Gilbert’s daughter, Marion, flees the castle with the Great Seal of Locksay. The Baron wants it back but he hasn’t counted on the youthful cunning of Robin and the village children. Rated: G

results.title: Run Rebecca Run (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Peter Maxwell, Brendon Lunney and Independent Productions (AU)
results.brief_description: When the local newspaper offers a fully equipped bicycle to the young person submitting the best photograph of their pet with a suitable caption, Rebecca Porter quickly goes into the National Park with her cockatoo, Fancy. The photographic expedition goes well until a sandbank, on which she is posing Fancy, is threatened by the rapidly rising tide. While she is stranded, she meets Manuel, a ship’s deserter, who faces deportation. When Rebecca is eventually rescued, it is too late to enter the competition.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Maxwell, Brendon Lunney and Independent Productions (AU)

results.title: Winners : Top Kid (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Gary is a ten year old whizz kid from a lower class family who becomes a famous radio quiz kid and star. He is accepted by his classmates at last. Problems occur when the quiz show starts to rig the answers. Gary is left with a difficult decision between honesty and fame. Part of the “Winners” series.

results.title: Winners : The Paper Boy (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
During the Depression, Joe’s father gets the sack. The only money the family has is what 13 year old Joe earns from selling papers. Then Joe has a fight with his father and leaves home. He lives on the streets battling with his wits and his fists as he gets to know the characters of the city - the down and outs, the Communist agitators, the Sallies, and Old Harry.
